Specimen Type: Pus, tissue, and other body fluids
Purpose: To detect and identify Actinomyces species from clinical specimens through culture methods for accurate diagnosis.
Container: Sterile screw-capped container, anaerobic transport medium, or plain dry swab in a sterile tube
Equipment: Anaerobic chamber or jars, 35–37 °C incubator, blood agar plates, chocolate agar plates, anaerobic blood agar plates, thioglycollate broth, Gram stain reagents, catalase test reagents
